titleStmt.title: GETTING STARTED WITH YOUR ENCODING PROJECT

div.head: GETTING STARTED WITH YOUR ENCODING PROJECT

div.p: This is a brief set of instructions which should help get you started in encoding your play.

div.head: A. CREATE YOUR XML PLAY FILE

list.item: Make sure this file (instructions.xml) is open in Oxygen, and you're looking at it.
Press the red triangle button you see on the Oxygen toolbar.

When asked, provide an id for your file. This must be in a format suitable for an @xml:id attribute, so:
it must begin with a letter
it must not contain spaces or punctuation
it should be short but distinctive
lower-case is preferred Examples:
h8 (for Henry VIII)
iyknmykn (If You Know Not Me, You Know Nobody)
rt (The Revengers Tragedy)
Now type your id here: yourPlayId

When asked, provide a short (modern) title for the play. This will be used as the title in the play metadata.
Type the title of the play here: Your Play Title
A new file should be created for you, with a filename based on the @xml:id. Open that file and you can begin editing.

div.head: B. CREATE YOUR LIST OF CHARACTERS
div.p: The next stage is to construct a character list in the header of the file you have created. The reason this has to be done first is that when you come to mark up speeches in the play, each speech will be associated with one or more characters, and the character ids must be available so that you can do that.
